item.title: Google Releases Open Source Library for Software Composition Analysis
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Google releases OSV-SCALIBR, an open source library for software composition analysis and file system scanning.

The post Google Releases Open Source Library for Software Composition Analysis appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 13, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 13, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: US Announces Sanctions Against North Korean Fake IT Worker Network
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US Treasury has sanctioned two individuals and four entities involved in the North Korean fake IT worker scheme.

The post US Announces Sanctions Against North Korean Fake IT Worker Network appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Reactions to Biden’s Cybersecurity Executive Order: Feedback Friday
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Industry professionals comment on the Biden administration’s new executive order on cybersecurity. 

The post Industry Reactions to Biden’s Cybersecurity Executive Order: Feedback Friday appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vulnerabilities in SimpleHelp Remote Access Software May Lead to System Compromise
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Three vulnerabilities in SimpleHelp could allow attackers to compromise the remote access software’s server and the client machine.

The post Vulnerabilities in SimpleHelp Remote Access Software May Lead to System Compromise appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco Unveils New AI Application Security Solution
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Cisco has unveiled AI Defense, a solution designed to help organizations protect development and use of AI applications. 

The post Cisco Unveils New AI Application Security Solution appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Russian Cyberspies Caught Spear-Phishing with QR Codes, WhatsApp Groups
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Microsoft researchers catches Russia's Star Blizzard hackers spear-phishing with QR codes and WhatsApp group chats.

The post Russian Cyberspies Caught Spear-Phishing with QR Codes, WhatsApp Groups appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Millions of Internet Hosts Vulnerable to Attacks Due to Tunneling Protocol Flaws
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
New research shows that over 4 million systems on the internet, including VPN servers and home routers, are vulnerable to attacks due to tunneling protocol flaws.

The post Millions of Internet Hosts Vulnerable to Attacks Due to Tunneling Protocol Flaws appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Wultra Raises €3 Million for Post-Quantum Authentication
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Authentication solutions provider Wultra has raised €3 million (~$3.1 million) for its post-quantum technology.

The post Wultra Raises €3 Million for Post-Quantum Authentication appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 380,000 Impacted by Data Breach at Cannabis Retailer Stiiizy
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Cannabis retailer Stiiizy says hackers stole the personal information of 380,000 consumers from one of its vendors.

The post 380,000 Impacted by Data Breach at Cannabis Retailer Stiiizy appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Targeting Freelance Software Developers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
North Korea-linked Lazarus Group is targeting freelance software developers to compromise the supply chain.

The post North Korean Hackers Targeting Freelance Software Developers appeared first on SecurityWeek.
